turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: I can't! It's out of control!

turns.speaker: LORELEI
turns.text: But how? Where's it getting the power from ???!

turns.speaker: MISS HENDERSON
turns.text: Mr. White, please, it's time for you to draw this month's winning JINGO number.  The prize is an all-expenses trip to South America.

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: Why can't the idiot in Circulation who dreamed up this imbecile contest in the first place ---

turns.speaker: MISS HENDERSON
turns.text: Because you're the Editor-in-Chief. Your integrity is unquestioned. LOIS I have a question.

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: Okay? Goodbye.

turns.speaker: MISS HENDERSON
turns.text: You've got to pick three more numbers.

turns.speaker: MISS HENDERSON
turns.text: Mr. White, the next number, please?

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: How'm I supposed to turn this thing?

turns.speaker: MISS HENDERSON
turns.text: By hand. Like the pioneers did.

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: Couldn't we just get a computer to do this?

turns.speaker: MISS HENDERSON
turns.text: Mr. White, you be in this shot, handing them their plane tickets.

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: Why do I have to do this?

turns.speaker: MISS HENDERSON
turns.text: It's modern. It's up-to-date. It's state-of-the art.  People, I am in love with this machine.  Go ahead, Mr. White.

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: Where's the handle?

turns.speaker: MISS HENDERSON
turns.text: There is no handle! You just push a button.

turns.speaker: SIMPSON
turns.text: 85,000 dollars.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Missing????

turns.speaker: SIMPSON
turns.text: Embezzled, Mr. Webster.  Stolen from the firm.

turns.speaker: SIMPSON
turns.text: I don't know who. Whom. I can't trace it.  In the old days it was simple. We kept books, we had ledgers, we could see what was going in and what was paid out. If somebody wanted to rob you, he'd come in with a gun and say 'stick 'em up."  Now they get theses blasted computers to do their dirty work!

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: My friend, you are yesterday. Whoever pulled this caper is tomorrow.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Now, Vera...uh, Simpson, you know my Staff Dietician?

turns.speaker: SIMPSON
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Well, chum? What now? Kiss the 85 thou goodbye? Pay some thief's salary while he thinks up new ways to shake the money tree?

turns.speaker: SIMPSON
turns.text: He's bound to slip up sooner or later.

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: That's what I want to know! By whom? Whom????

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Get a hold of yourself, Vera.  Nobody else ever will.

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: I don't kiss.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Oh, right. Well then, just shake hands.

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: Vulcan is the weather satellite						our government put up in orbit to monitor the weather.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: But if somebody re-programmed it, it could do much more.

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: It could make weather!

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Storms! Floods!

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: Blizzards! Heat waves!

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Computers talk to other computers, right?

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: Somehow your twisted little mind should be able to figure out how to tap into the main computer at the Aerospace Center and reach Vulcan.

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: She's not his mama either.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Gus Gorman, this is my Psychic Nutritionist.

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: Someplace where nobody knows him so they can't connect him with us.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Well, Webco has a hundred and twelve subsidiaries and every one of them is tied to our central computer system. How about...hmmmm, someplace small...

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: You mean...you mean...Vera! Vera! The magnitude of this!!!

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: Today coffee----

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: TOMORROW THE OIL!

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: Small potatoes.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: We already have a super-tanker.

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: Chicken feed.  If Gus Gorman can push the right buttons ---

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: I could have it all! Holy cats! All the oil! All the tankers! All the pumps! The gosh-darn world will be out to lunch! No heat, no gas--sis, this is some nifty idea!

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: He ruined it! That lousy do-gooder, he ruined it.

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: Don't cry, Bubba.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Nice try, Butch,  but it wouldn't be effective against Superman.  You'll see! Now that he's pulled this stunt, he'll stick his nose in my oil scheme and ruin that one, too! I've got to get rid of him! I've got to!

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: How? Shoot him? You know about him and bullets. Not to mention knives, tanks, bombs...

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Wait a minute! She's right! Kryptonite. I remember reading about it in an interview with him.  Nuts...

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: I just remembered the rest. There isn't any more. The only chunk that ever landed on Earth disappeared a couple of years ago. It was in this story in the Daily Planet.

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: Where did it come from?

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: The planet Superman came from. Krypton.

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: So all we've got to do is pick up the garbage.  We just have to find our where in Heaven Krypton used to be. Then good old Gus here contacts the Vulcan satellite--

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Don't you see? Okay, so you didn't kill him. Nobody's perfect. But that stuff we ran up in the lab wasn't a complete failure after all.  Right after Gus gave it to him, Superman started to turn into a selfish, ornery, malicious, conniving...

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: A normal person.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: And now that Superman's out of the Nice Guy business...

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: We can get to work on that oil!

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: That's it! The last tanker! They're all mine now! All...

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: Not quite. What is that in the lower right hand corner?

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: Come on, let's give it a dry run.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Wait for Gus to get here, sis.

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: Who needs Gus?

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: He's the only one who can operate this --

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: Like fish he is.  I know enough about computers to put a PHD to shame.  Come now, brother dear, you didn't think I was going to let that little man run the show, did you? Gus Gorman telling us what to do -- I'd sooner kiss a pig!

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: He's coming! He's going to hurt me!

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: Don't bet on it!

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: Yes! This time we got it right!

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: It's your genius, pal! You built a machine that can find anybody's weak spot, just like you said.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Jimmy, how's the -

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Yeah. I'll check.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Anybody been hurt?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: So far the hostages are unharmed.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Hostages?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Tourists, about twenty of 'em.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Are you okay?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: She'll be fine.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Lois, I usually do.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Then maybe you should get your glasses checked.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Not everyone can have X-ray vision, you know.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Do I detect a note of jealousy?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Lois, what are you doing?

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: When was the last time you heard me sneeze?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Uh. . .

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Well, you never will again!  Thanks to Vitamin C! I'm reading a book that says the foundation of a sound body structure is one thousand milligrams of Vitamin C every day.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: One thousand?? That's an awful lot of oranges. You know there are pill, Lois. I've seen them.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Oh sure. The American answer to everything. Pills.  No, this is --  -- natural.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: I don't?

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Of course not. Not when you've got so much going for you.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: I do?

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Sure! But nobody knows it. Least of all you.  Look, would you mind if I gave you some constructive criticism?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Actually, yes.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Well, you shouldn't  Be more aggressive, Clark! Trust your instinct! When you see your opportunity, grab it! I do.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Lois, why don't you at least get one of those automatic ones?

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Haven't you heard? There's an energy crisis.  No, this was good enough for my mother --

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Maybe I could try --

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Be my guest.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Clark, everything I was saying -- can't you see I only say it because I really care?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Of course, that's what friends are for.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: It is kinda romantic.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: In July???

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: 'Magic Fingers.' Fifty cents.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Hah, some guys say I have magic fingers.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Oh, you're a great writer, Lois, nobody doubts that.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Yeah, thanks. . . . I mean, really! Posing as newlyweds to uncover the honeymoon racket in Niagara Falls.  I mean,. imagine wasting a great reporter -  -- uh, reporters -- on this.  Perry White and his Sunday Magazine exposes.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: But this should be exposed. They get	kids here who are just starting out in life and they take them for every nickel they can get. That's what Perry says.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: A "complimentary corsage."

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Oh sure, everything is complimentary. Until you get the bill.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: I was. . . uh. . . just wondering about the.. . .the.. . . the uh, arrangements.  Sleeping arrangements.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Mr. Smith -  -- the "complimentary couch."

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: I don't know, they look pretty happy to me...

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: That's because you can hardly see through those things.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Hey, are you hungry? I'm hungry.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Lois, you're amazing.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Aw, c'mon -- anybody can get hungry.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: No. I mean here you stand with one of nature's most awesome spectacles and the whole time you've had your back to it. Aren't you impressed?

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Frankly, once you've seen Superman in action, Niagara Falls tends to leave you cold.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Where were you?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: I was getting hot dogs. What do you mean?

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: I mean it strikes me funny that every time Superman comes around, you disappear.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Superman? Oh, was he here?

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: And you weren't. As usual. What do you say to that?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Lois, I don't have the vaguest idea -- as usual -- what you're --

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Don't fake me out, Clark.  Or whoever you are.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Whoever, I  Look, maybe you ought to take a walk and clear your head. I'II meet you back at the motel.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Who ????

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Listen, I've got to give you credit. Your disguise is nearly perfect. I mean, if you fooled me, and I am nobody's fool --

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: No, of course not, Lois. You just get carried away sometimes. Believe me, I understand --

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: You've been under a lot of pressure lately -

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Uh-uh.  Listen, I'll tell you what. You say I'm wrong. And I say I'm right. So why don't we make a little bet on it?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: How could you win a crazy bet like --

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Because of what I'm betting.  My life.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: What??

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Oh Clark, no!

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Lois, help! I can't --  I can't swim -- !

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: It's true. It's true.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Lois, I . . .

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: I was right. you are Superman.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Oh come on, that's ridic -

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: You don't have anything to be sorry 	about.  How could I . . .

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Maybe you wanted to.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: I didn't think I wanted to.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Well, not in your mind, but maybe . . .deep in your heart . . .

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: I'm in love with you. How do you feel?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: We'd better talk.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: I'm listening.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Not here, Perry'll be calling at six to find out what's happening.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: "What's happening." Oh, is that the understatement of the year. Well, so . . . where do you want to . . . talk?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: I guess it would be all right if -  Lois, now that you know me, I think you ought to know it all.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: I want to.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Let's go to my place.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Let's go to my place.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Your place?  Maybe I should change,  Maybe you should, too.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: You did it. You gave it all up for me. I . . . I don't know what to say.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Say you love me.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Clark . . . it doesn't matter . . . we can move . . .

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Do you . . . ah . . . want to step outside?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Blood . . . my . . . blood . . .

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Let's get you inside . . . .

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Maybe we ought to hire a bodyguard from now on.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: I don't want a bodyguard. I want the man I fell in love with.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: I know that, Lois. And I wish he were here . . .

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: I have to go back . . .to the Fortress . . .

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: But what can you do? There's no way now . . .

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: I have to try, dammit! Something, anything . . .

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Don't . . . it's not your fault . . . you didn't know . . .

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: He knew. I heard him. I just didn't listen.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Oh, hi.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Sleep well?

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Never closed my eyes.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: I know, I know all the arguments, you don't have to tell me. That's what I did all night -- I "listened to the voices of  reason" till the dawn came up. Do you have any idea what a vile sound it to hear the first bird singing when you've been up night crying?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Me too, Oh, I tried to convince myself, believe me, "It's like being married to a doctor," I said. Doctors are practically never at home. The get emergency calls in the middle of the night and their wives manage to live with it. Then a voice said, " could you be a doctor's wife? Or are you too selfish . . . "

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: You're not selfish at all.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Oh, when it comes to you I am. Not that I don't understand why they all need you. but they can't need you more than I do.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: "They?"

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Everybody. Everybody else. I'd be buying my little rainbow at the their expense. All the ones who say "Help. Come quick. Now" I know who you'd have to pick.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: What else could I do?

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Oh, I'm not blaming you.  I just know me. I'd be jealous. Jealous of . . . of all humanity.  Some rival, huh?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Lois, someday --

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Please don't tell me "You'll find somebody else someday." Cause . . .  . . . well, you are a pretty hard act to follow, you'll have to admit that.  Oh, I'll get by, don't worry about me.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: I like worrying about you.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: See what happens when I don't have my orange juice?  The human body is only a workable, fairly fragile machine when you treat it with the same respect you'd show to ----  . . . gee . . .

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Take it easy. Take a deep breath.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: I'm fine. . . . . .  What  was I talking about?  Before?

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: . . . Superman?. . . . .

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Lois, I really don't see why --

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Clark, stop feeling so threatened every time you hear his name. Nobody expects you to be what you're not.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: I'll try to remember that . . .

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Well, you should. Because I appreciate you, too, you know.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: You do?

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Sure. Especially if you'd be a really terrific guy and bring me a cheeseburger to go --

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Everything on it?

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Everything on it.

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: Get your head out of the clouds, Kent. Where you been  the last twelve hours?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Uh...home...

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: Don't you watch television? Don't you listen to the radio?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Actually I was trying to catch up on my reading. There's a lot of Dickens I never got around to --

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: Dickens! The whole world's about to blow up and you're reading Dickens?!

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: But . . ..that's terrible!

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: That's why they call 'em terrorists.  Go down to the morgue and dig up anything you can find on past incidents of --

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Does Lois know about this yet?

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: Does she know about it? She's in it!

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: What??

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: The minute the story broke I bundled her on the first Concord out of here. If Paris goes kablooey I want the best reporter I've got right there in the middle of it.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Gee. But --

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: No offense, Kent. You're good, but Lois is the best we've got.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: No, I meant, it's awfully dangerous.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Lex...Lex, how could you do that to Otis?

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: What else is ballast for?

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: How would you like to take a little vacation? I mean you've earned it, you know? You deserve it.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: There is some good in you, Lex, after all.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: You'll have to pack quickly.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: A bikini! I'll need to buy a new bikini, Lex.  C'mon. After being cooped up in that prison, haven't you thought about me in a bikini . . ...once maybe ?

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: A parka.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: You thought about me in a parka. That's sick, Lex. Really.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: North!

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Mush!  Mush!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Look at this! Snow. Ice.  Your idea of a good time.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: A good time! Is that all you care about?!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: I wouldn't know. I've never had one.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: I like trees.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: So does your average cocker spaniel. Give me another one.  Under . . . the big one there.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: You'll miss the battle of the century!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Good. My heart can't take it.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Your heart, Miss Teschmacher? I never knew you had one.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Well done, Miss Teschmacher.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Why am I doing this? Why am I here?

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Is this a philosophy seminar? No. This is getaway.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: This way Lex.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: It' s fantastic! ----- This place is genius.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Genius!  --  Lex.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: I'll be alright.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: No, me, me, me. Thank you.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: It's beautiful.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: It's beautiful.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: It has everything.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Wrong.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Why didn't you go before we left?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: That was two days ago. Frankly, I think this place is a bit boring. It's all white. Why doesn't the guy put up some posters? Maybe some bullfight things . . .

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: It's beautiful.

turns.speaker: SECOND CONTROLLER
turns.text: Artemis? Do you read me?

turns.speaker: FIRST CONTROLLER
turns.text: What'd he say before? He saw a girl?

turns.speaker: SECOND CONTROLLER
turns.text: I think he said a "curl."

turns.speaker: FIRST CONTROLLER
turns.text: What's a curl?

turns.speaker: SECOND CONTROLLER
turns.text: Isn't that what the old Canaveral guys used to call a comet on an East-West trajectory?

turns.speaker: FIRST CONTROLLER
turns.text: How the hell would I know? I was in high school back in those days.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Mr. White, the pressroom wants to know how much longer to hold the front page.

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: Give it another ten minutes. If we don't --  Hell, I'll tell him.  Pete? If we haven't got anything new in the next ten minutes just go with the wire service copy under the 40 pt. banner and run the picture for three columns.  Kent,	I need a background story for the page 3 sidebar. Give me every thing you know about this terrorist group.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: A gang of terrorists seized the Eiffel Tower in Paris

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: He knows where the Eiffel Tower is, Olsen.  You do, don't you, Kent?

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: I can't understand it! Where is he? I mean, he shows up every time a cat gets stuck in a tree, and  now he decides to pull a disappearing act?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Maybe we just don' t know his game plan.

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: Game plan! It's fourth down and long yardage, the two-minute warning sounded and the ball's deep in our territory! How brilliant do you have to be?!

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Superman's got something up his sleeve, that's for sure. We just haven't figured it out. Isn't that right, Miss Lane?

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: You no longer can serve humanity if you invest your time and emotion in one of them at the expense of the rest.  Surely this is not how you repay their gratitude, Kal-El. Could you really abandon the weak and the needy merely to fulfill some selfish dream.

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: Selfish! But they get a chance at happiness. Can't I have that chance?

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: You have been given a higher form of happiness. The happiness you feel by serving others, by inspiring them to --

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: Yes, but it's not all I feel.

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: Patience, Kal-El. You begin to sound like an Earthling. SUPERMAN Mother, you speak only of honor, of sacrifice, of responsibility --

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: Because that is your heritage. Those are the values we lived by on Krypton.

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: But you had more than that, and I know it. You and my father --  you had each other.  Can I never have what you had?

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: And she -- the one you have chosen -- she feels as much for you?

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: -- as the keeper of the archives of Krypton, it falls to me to tell you of the darkest episode in our planets history.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Now This I want to hear.

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: For many eons the peoples of our world have lived together in harmony. Then there appeared among us three anti-social elements - what on Earth are classified as "criminals."

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: My kind of people.

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: The three proved - after exhaustive efforts - incapable of rehabilitation. Now as you know, we had no death penalty -

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Sensible enough.

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: And so our scientists constructed, from an irreversible mathematical equation, the Phantom Zone. In it we imprisoned these three arch-villains for all eternity.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: No possibility for parole?

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: The Elders have, of course, thought long and hard about that question.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: I asked the right question.

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: The one danger we have considered is that the Phantom Zone might - we cannot predict - just might be cracked by a nuclear explosion in space. I cannot say I am glad you asked me that -

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: I didn't ask her anything . . .

turns.speaker: OTIS
turns.text: Don't feel bad, Mr. Luthor. It almost worked. I mean California almost threw up right in the ocean. Millions of people almost killed. If it hadn't been for that guy Superman - that overgrown boyscout...

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: I want my Liberace record back tonight.

turns.speaker: OTIS
turns.text: DELETE IN CUTTING

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: DELETE IN CUTTING

turns.speaker: OTIS
turns.text: I mean they can't even trace that guy on that radar they got, every time they try he just flies off.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: OTIS
turns.text: North.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: OTIS
turns.text: To ski?

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: OTIS, your brain defies any known scientific laws in its infinite capacity to deteriorate. Every man has a vulnerable point. Some like you Otis, have more that one. I didn't see Superman's in time. But now through patience, invention and skill, my 	black box is just about ready.

turns.speaker: OTIS
turns.text: Oh! That black box in our cell?

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Shhhhhhh!

turns.speaker: OTIS
turns.text: That little black box, Mr. Luthor, I mean -- what's it for?

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: That little black box goes beyond any known conventional radar, it tracks Alpha Waves.

turns.speaker: OTIS
turns.text: Ahhhhhh -- Alpha Waves.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Wait, wait, wait just a moment. Wait till you've got to know better will you please.  Wait, -- look, I can give you anything you want. I can give you the brass ring, the - er -- unlimited freedom to maim, cure, destroy, chew - plus Lex Luthor's savvy. Lex Luthor's career guidance... Lex Luthor's School of...

turns.speaker: ZOD
turns.text: We have all of this without you. You cannot bargain with what you don't have.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Oh magnificent one. What I am bargaining with is what you do not have -- the son  of Jor-El.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: No, Jor-El, the baseball player that came from Porto Rico. Yes Jor-El your Jailer.

turns.speaker: ZOD
turns.text: The son of Jor-El on this Planet?

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Oh my Fullness, as I explained to you before, I am about the best there is. Second best there is.

turns.speaker: ZOD
turns.text: Revenge! We will kill the son of our jailer!

turns.speaker: ZOD
turns.text: He flies as well, then . . .

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Constantly.

turns.speaker: ZOD
turns.text: He has powers as we do . . .

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Certainly. But - Er. Oh Magnificent one, he's just one, but you are three, or four even, if you count him twice.

turns.speaker: ZOD
turns.text: We will bring him to his knees!

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Oh, General, the world is a big place. Thank goodness, my needs are small...As  it turns out, I have this affinity for beachfront property . . .

turns.speaker: ZOD
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Australia.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Superman! The --

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: Really Lois, we've got to stop meeting this --

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: The bomb! It's in there! Any second now, its --

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: You must be freezing.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: I must be. But I'm not.  Your home. This is your home.

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: Well . . . it's been more like a fortress than a home.  Until now.

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: So --  I hope you like it.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Like it? It's magnificent!  Not that it couldn't use a woman's touch. Especially around dinner time.

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: Dinner. Oh yes.  I'm sorry, I just never do much about that.  But tonight -- I mean, anything you want, Lois.

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: I never did this before . . . I have to tell you.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Hey, don't worry. You'll be fine, Just . . . well, don't rush it.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: It must be tough, having to be Clark Kent.

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: Oh no.  I really like it sometimes.  And if it weren't for him, I wouldn't have met you.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: But him is you.  Now I'm confused.
